column1: Morro Agudo (Portuguese for "Sharp Hill") is a municipality in the state of São Paulo in Brazil. The population is 31
column2: 620 (2015 est.) in an area of 1388 km². The elevation is 546 m. The city is the biggest Brazilian sugar-cane producer.
